reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to get away for a weekend in March. As usual the Venetian was a great stay. In the middle of March Madness we were able to get a good deal through their promotional e-mails. Our stays here have always been pleasant with good service, perfect location and large rooms. However, the rooms are starting to show their age. The Venetian should consider room renovations to compete with the newer resorts.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: We have stayed here a few times before. Rooms are all suits and spacious. Good service. Had slippers and toothbrushes upon request. Housekeeping was quick and great. rooms have bee remodeled but the issue is the hotel is so huge that when we stayed at the Venezia towers, it took 5 minutes and many turns to get to the casino floors. Long walk with young kids. Many pools available but basic pools and nothing fancy like slides etc. our room was nice but the sofa was slightly worn out and the water would build up when showering. Minor issues. Other than that, well worth the money to get additional space.
reviews.title: Nice as usual!

reviews.text: Very nice Hotel, with very spacious rooms and bathrooms. We went with kids and that was fine. Lots of restaurants and the shopping mall was great! The outdoor spaces were good but too crowded. The chairs at the swimming pool were placed very close and that was not confortable!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Helpful staff at the concierge. Easy check in and check out! The weekend was very busy at the Hotel and the corridors were very noisy during the night!
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights. We had great service, beginning with the check in desk to the maintenance personnel. The room was decadently decorated. Our room overlooked the "strip" which was very exciting at night. The hotel decor is breath-taking and I found myself walking around staring at the gorgeously painted ceilings. It was very busy there and I didn't care much to have to haul my luggage through the casino to get to the elevators. However, it was secure, there was a guard that asked to see your room key before getting on the elevators to our room.
reviews.title: doris day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a stay at the Venetian as part of our mini tour of California and Nevada
reviews.title: Opulent and fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The TA reviews are pretty spot on and I cannot really add too much to what has already been posted by others
reviews.title: Beautiful and great location

reviews.text: Our Suite was beautiful, nice bathroom, extremely comfortable bed and a good seating area, all spotless and well cleaned
reviews.title: Great Location but Rooms Have Taken a Beating

reviews.text: We were on the 24th floor toward the rear of the hotel and the view from our room was the Wynn Golf Course so not too bad
reviews.title: Vagas Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is quite big and the casino equally so, once you get your bearings navigating the hotel, casino and shops is reasonably easy
reviews.title: My favorite place in Vegas !!

reviews.text: Great place to stay, great restaurants, and night club is a hit too. We had 5 adult couples ranging in age from 25-50 and everyone had a great time.
reviews.title: Fun adult weekend
Nice Suite with "resort fee"
reviews.text: The hotel location is excellent in the center of the LV strip.All rooms are suite and very nice with all the luxury details with large bathroom and separate living room...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not take anything in the fridge even you do not use it they still charge it.
reviews.title: First time in Las Vegas

reviews.text: One negative point is no in-room coffee. At the end of the stay, they will charge an additional $20 per day for the Resort fee(?). They have 2 queen beds and one sofa bed so a party of 4 / family can stay in one room comfortably. It is reasonable price during weekdays sun-thurs for less than $150 per nite excluding tax (12%) and resort fee ($20).
reviews.title: Always wonderful- never a disappointment! Great Yr of the Dragon display!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it is very expensive during weekend or holidays ($400-500/ night) for a 5 stars hotel in LV strip.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: The Venetian is the most beautiful hotel in Vegas. If you have been to the "real" Venice you will know that this is not what Venice really looks like, but it is still a beautiful property. The only thing I didn't like is that food in the hotel is far from the rooms. Our suite was absolutely breathtaking and the beds were wonderfully comfortable. It was very quiet. I found the cheapest rate for this property at ------------- but found out later if I had notified the hotel within 48 hours of finding that rate they would have given us a free upgrade at that price. We stayed 3 days at the Venetian, rented a car and went to the Grand Canyon for 2 days and then came back and stayed at the Paris. The Paris is nice, too, but not as nice as The Venetian.
reviews.title: The Venetian is a beautiful hotel
This is Las Vegas
reviews.text: Wow!

reviews.title: Expected more
reviews.text: This is by far the best I've stayed in Vegas!

reviews.title: Very good, but...
reviews.text: Decoration is awesome and rooms are great (even by size)! Got a cool deal for the Venetain Suite for two nights... ... Best room in Vegas!

reviews.title: Wow!!!!!!
reviews.text: Check in was easy and fast, Valet service was always freindly, they put our Vette and Hummer on the side, so we didn't have to wait them to bring the cars out of the garage!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first time to Vegas and the Venetian had been highly recommended to us, could not believe all the reviews when we got there was so much more than we expected, check in queue was big but so quick and the staff were amazing. We were booked for the bella suite but offered an upgrade when we arrived and took it! The suite we were in was amazing and by far the best bathroom I have ever seen.
reviews.title: Amazing birthday trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband had made a few special requests through our travel agent prior to the trip and the hotel had them all noted and delivered on them all - a surprise for such a huge hotel.
reviews.title: Romantic Weekend at the Venetian Las Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the hotel was amazing, staff so friendly and helpful and by far one of the best hotels we have stayed in. Would certainly recommend it to any of my friends or family and would almost certainly book this hotel again, amazing.
reviews.title: Wowsa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First rate all the way from the time of check in until picking up our luggage after checking out and spending a little more time in Las Vegas. I have difficulty walking or standing for any length of time and traveled with my scooter. The staff; Doneesha helping set up our reservation and tickets to see the Phantom of the Opera, Marvin bringing our bags up quickly so we could have time to rest and get dressed to see the play and offering his assistance if we needed anything else, the Concierge Hermela obtaining tickets for us to see the Cirque du Soleil show Love, the valets helping my husband to load my scooter, housekeeping making our room look beautiful again while we were out having a great time. The staff at the Venetian is amazing - all so warm and welcoming. We just wish there were a higher rating to give you! oh and to a few that were irritated about not having a hair dryer...it is in the drawer of the vanity table :-)
reviews.title: Luxury personified, shame about the resort fee.

reviews.text: This building is enormous! It is beautiful where ever you look. The rooms are very spacious and very clean. The beds are great, pillows are lovely. I had a room in the Venezzia tower with a strip view, very nice! The only problem I really had with this hotel is the time it took to get out! We had to walk forever to get to our car. The Venetian tower isnt as bad. I would stay here again, but if I ever go back to Las Vegas, I would have to try another hotel just because there are so many to see! This one is phenomenal tho! Loved it!!!
reviews.title: Nice place to be around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sayed here for 2 nights starting Saturday and was really impressed and how luxurious rooms were we stayed on 25th floor Venezia tower, Definately worth experiencing.
reviews.title: Beautiful Can Be Noisy

likes.liked: — It Felt Like You Were Really In Rome

reviews.text: I would recommend you taking the luggage service to your room as to get to your room from the lobby is a maze and you have to walk through casino.
reviews.title: A fantastic Vegas hotel experience

likes.liked: — Spacious suites; wide range of amentities; decor/theme; security/safety

reviews.text: The only faults I would say is the constant room service or the maids bellowing "ROOM SERVICE" in the hallyway at 8.30am onwards at other rooms this goes on and on (note they knock once and then enter so if you can lock your door)
reviews.title: Last time we will stay at the Venetian :(

likes.disliked: — Smell of sewage, smell of perfume and hot, loud rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: other doors slamming shut all day this became a bit of a nuisance maybe if they installed softly close doors this would stop the noise.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — $80 a day for my husband and I to use a treadmill was too expensive

reviews.text: Lots and lots of empty designer shops inside hotel are great to window shop or even shop if you can afford it
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Went to the Venetian with some girlfriends for New Years Week 2008. This hotel is old and worn out and desperatly needs updating. The rooms are faded, many problems with the room itself.
reviews.title: Old and Worn Out

likes.disliked: — old, worn out, poor service from staff, multiple problems with the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I checked in, I noticed the mini-bar door was ajar. Looked closer to find that it was broken and wouldn't close. I called the operator and she said an engineer would be right up to fix it. 1 HOUR LATER - the engineer arrived. he said "yup, it's broken" and said they'd have to replace it. I asked when and he said "lots of things more important than this to fix first".
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!

likes.disliked: — Elevators too far from the front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself had seen better days, handles missing off of cabinets, stains on the carpets and a strange sounding drain that was so loud it woke us both in the middle of the night....and no one was using the water!
reviews.title: Nice rooms, Horrible smell

reviews.text: Then the next day the door to the safe wouldn't close, it was locked while open! I called downstairs and was told I would have to wait for someone to come as a guest had to be present when working on the safe. My friend stayed in the room and waited for 3 hours, calling frequently to check on status. They finally came and fixed it but it wasted most of her day.
reviews.title: FABULOUS ROOMS

likes.liked: — friendly warm staff and the room and the chinese restaurant..yummmm.

reviews.title: Not as great as last visit . . .
reviews.text: Overall, this should have been a great hotel - for $350 a day, it should have been terrific. But they've obviously spent more time and attention on their new property next door - The Pallazzo - which is quite nice. When we booked spa appointments at the Canyon Ranch Spa at the hotel, we arrived to check in only to be told we had to use the spa next door at The Pallazzo and it was a 5 minute walk to the other location. Upon arriving, we were told we were late for our appts. and would forfit the time! The spa is like a factory with so many people running through it was the least relaxing time I've ever had.

I've read so many reviews about this hotel and I have to say that it totally exceeded my expectations! We stayed in a Bella Suite in the Venezia Tower... The room was beautiful, elegantly decorated and had the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in! Whilst in Vegas, we visited all of the other hotels and genuinely felt the Venetian had much more to offer and had an exciting buzz about it every day!
reviews.title: Fantastic New Year Holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in quite a few of the restaurants and each and everyone of them delivered excellent service and fantastic food!
reviews.title: Been to Venice, and still enjoyed the Venetian

reviews.text: We had a great night, seeing Rock of Ages the Musical in the hotel theatre! A great show, witty, funny and really entertaining! Go see it if you're there!
reviews.title: Happy Holiday Enchantment

reviews.text: The hotel offers great accommodation with so much more to offer within the grounds. I'll be back, that's for sure :o)
reviews.title: Beautiful Vegas Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you for a great stay!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and lots of amenities!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each time we visit Las Vegas, we like to stay in a different hotel. We were happy with what we found at the Venetian. We booked a Southwest Airlines package, and other than the $60 resort fee, we felt like we got what we paid for. Staff was friendly when dealt with one on one. I did return to the room a couple of times smelling like a cigarette since we had to walk through the casino to get to the elevators to get to the suites, but other than the Bellagio, this seems to be the case with all the LV hotels on the strip. The only issue we had during our stay was with the towels! The first night we had one towel and one washcloth per person. The next night we were left with no towels at all. After a call to housekeeping, extras were made available. The only other complaint is that the lighting in the bathroom made it very hard to put on makeup! Even though a lighted mirror is provided, it still was a very dark space. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel--nicely appointed suites!!
Just Beautiful!
reviews.text: Every year in December, I go to the A4M conference (Anti-Aging Medicine) in Las Vegas and I stay at either the Venetian or the Palazzo. Today's review will be about the Venetian. It is definitely my favorite. You want to spend at hour just in the lobby admiring the breathtakingly beautiful artwork on the ceilings and on the floors. Art aficionados will definitely want to stay here and bring your iPhones and/cameras. The suites are elegant. The sunken living room is quite large and somehow, it gives you a sense of privacy even though you are not far from the beds. The decor and choice of furniture are cozy.

Believe it or not, the most beautiful part of the suite is the stunning bathroom with it's large glass-enclosed shower and the toilet actually get a separate room altogether. (LOL, there is even a phone in this little room!) There are large his and her sinks and mirrors everywhere. Also you will notice in the "bedroom" portion, the backdrop or paneling behind the beds. It's very expensive and creative looking with square-like cushions on the wall. Finally the lighting is very nice in the suites - lots of lights that can be all turned off by a Master switch if you like to conserve. (there are also privacy lights if you are with roommate in a DB room).
reviews.title: Good choice for any type of trip

reviews.text: The Venetian will definitely be a favorite of yours!
reviews.title: 2nd Trip to Venetian over Christmas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel through Expedia for my bff's Bachelorette Party. Don't regret a thing, except perhaps not bringing more money! The front desk staff was a little unhelpful in regards to a room upgrade that had been promised via Expedia, but then not awarded because I didn't have 'proof.' But I've since learned you have to roll with the punches when you deal with Expedia. I've been all over Italy, and it really made me feel like I was back there, the food feels like real Italian food, and the gelato was heavenly! Don't forget, you get free drinks when you sit at a penny slot, BUT you'll generally have to grab a waitress and tip her first. Continuing tipping (I tipped a buck or two per) and she will come back to check on you.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: Was torn between The Bellagio and The Venetian, but went for The Venetian as the amazing price of €85 per nite was too good to pass up!
reviews.title: As good as we knew it would be!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my wife and some friends as part of a 2 week trip of the West Coast (ish)..
reviews.title: An amazing stay
Average which is a shame
reviews.text: This hotel really is everything it claims to be..The suites are just amazing, huge, luzurious...3 TVs!
It is a city in itself, excellent restaurants, great shops, cool bars...loved the oxygen bar, that was fun! The casino is very professional, maybe a little rigid for an amateur like myself!
reviews.title: Dissapointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was superb, staff were very attentive considering the size of the hotel..check in /out was also fine again when you consider the amount of people constantly checking in.
reviews.title: Watch for the Come On about Free Breakfast and manadatory Resort Fees"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at the Venetian and Palazzo many times and have always loved the experience. This stay was a disappointment. The room at the Venetian was wonderful (as always), comfortable bed, nice amenities, etc. The problem was noise. We asked for a quiet room on a high floor. We were put on the 26th floor, overlooking the pools. Terrible. Well, only terrible if you don't enjoy listening the the loud thumping bass of the music from Tao Beach all day. I don't. I requested a room change on Sunday, but that wasn't possible. Was going to change rooms on Monday, but then was assured the noise would not be a problem during the week - so didn't bother (a retrospective mistake). Noise level was fine on Monday, but today, not so much. Good news is that it ends at 6:00 or so. Bad news is that enjoying a quiet nap or reading in the room in the afternoon was not in the cards. I suppose for most people this would not be a problem - only a problem if you want to enjoy some afernoon quiet time in the room. Lesson learned - don't get a room in the Venetian facing the pools in summer (no matter how high up) if you are senstive to noise. I actually prefer the Palazzo, so next time we'll stay there or not stay at all. Other downside of this stay was the construction going on in the casino. Not only was the room not so pleasant, but the casino too had the sounds of construction. Like I said, not a great stay.
reviews.title: Not a great stay

reviews.text: We have just visited Las Vegas with two boys, 10 & 13. At reception we upgraded to the Palazzo and a view over Treasure Island for $45 per night. Well worth it. Rooms were enormous with a separate lounge, 3 tv's and a great bathroom. No fridge though. You do need to walk through the Casino to get to the rooms but that is the same with any hotel in Vegas. It is near the big shopping mall which looks fantastic and walking distance to Bellagio and Paris at a pinch. It is situated down one end of the strip (not as far down as Circus, Circus) with the other end a bus or taxi ride away. We caught a taxi from Circus Circus to New York New York (the roller coaster here is the best apparently) so quite a long way. The casinos are huge and worlds themselves. We ate at Woolfgang Pucks Il Postiro? restaurant in the square at the Venetian which was fantastic. A couple of others are pretty ordinary and not any cheaper. We had an amazing breakfast at Boudin - well worth a visit. The pools are amazing on a warm day and Sundays they have an over 21 area with DJ's just like in the movies! The gondola ride in the Venetian was fun and there is heaps of shopping. Walgreens (chemist with a doctors) is downstairs and just outside at the Venetian. Overall we loved Vegas and there is so much to do. I would recommend the Venetian.
reviews.title: Venetian - Palazzo an awesome place to stay with Kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breath taking hotel!! As so as we entered the hotel we were mesmerized by the architecture and decor. Very clean hotel and helpful staff. There is so much to offer at the Venetian that you do not even have to leave the propery. Over 80 high end shops and 30 restaurants as well as a convenient food court to grab a quick lunch and bring it out to the pool. Very pretty setting outside, garden tressels to walk through to go to the pools. The only place I didn't care for was the Riva Cafe by the pool. The menu was very limited. We had dinner at the Aqua Knox restaurant and saw the Blue Man Group all for $150.00. That was a steal. The food is amazing and the show was incredible. Phantom of the Opera is also playing at the Venetian until September and it is a must see. 7 For All Man Kind jean store is one of the many high end shops. It happens to be my favorite jean store. We walked through many of the hotels while we were in Vegas and the Venetian by far was the nicest. We can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: AWESOME EXPERIENCE, CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!!

reviews.text: Massive hotel but to be expected. Great suites, great service, clean quality casino, entertainment, pool, shopping, restaurants and more. No complaints.
reviews.title: Amazing place

reviews.text: Check in was great, hotel fine. We had one suitcase we took to the room ourselves. Went out for a bit, came back to suite, or suitcase was gone! Apparently they (hotel) took it from our room and sent it home with another guest. Staff was not helpful and showed no compassion.
reviews.title: Where's my suitcase?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Venetian was absolutely brilliant. The hotel amenities, service, location etc were top class. The room we had booked was excactly as we had seen in brochures and on the website. The hotel was so large I often got lost when trying to navigate my way from the lobby to our room. Service from hotel staff was exceptional and the hotel itself was in pristine condition. We visited many of the other hotels located along the strip and are confident that the Venetian is the best hotel on the strip. Is ideal for couples or mature travellers looking for a classy hotel. It does not have the riff raff hanging around the hotel like so many others do along the strip. Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking to have an enjoyable stay in Vegas.
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant
Great place
reviews.text: First time to Vegas as a family (2 rooms on different floors). Most definitely delighted with Venetian. Great spacious rooms and bathroom. The lounge area was a bonus. Beds were comfortable. Loved the TV in the bathroom. Fantastic facilities and shops on site. Excellent location on the Strip. Restaurants were well priced and the food was excellent in the 2 restaurants visited.

Upon arrival it was a very busy time (3pm), took a long time for luggage to be delivered so we left to explore. Hotel not happy but after waiting over 30 minutes we decided not to waste valuable time.
reviews.title: Great Location on Strip

likes.liked: — Location and property options on site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front desk staff most attentive withany queries and on deparutre printed off boarding passes for flights.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel...Dirty Room

reviews.text: On the negative: corridors were smelly and took one day for rubbish to be picked up off the carpet in corridor (condom), no coffee facilities in room. Noise carries into room from corridor (so hope you are not next to noisy party).
reviews.title: Great Get Away Spot - Smelly, though

likes.disliked: — Sweet, air freshner smell that makes you feel sick it is so strong EVERYWHERE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like others who have posted recently, we arrived in the main lobby but were immediately escorted to the check-in area on the 10th floor of the Venezia Tower. The staff member behind the counter made a hard push for us to upgrade to the concierge level for an extra $100 per night. I found the routine amusing, since he kept emphasizing it was a one-time special being offered at that moment. I had been receiving e-mails about the upgrade offer for quite some time and am sure I also read it on their general website. After declining several times, he let it go.
reviews.title: Love the Venetian

reviews.text: I had reserved a strip view room and requested a remodeled room, which is what we had on our last visit. Upon arriving to our room, we discovered we were in the Venezia tower in a non-renovated room. Tired from travel, we decided to let it go and not trek down to the check-in area again to request a change. The room was fine but featured traditional decor, a smaller sitting area, one less flat screen tv, and older bedding. We did have a view of the strip, but we were on a very low floor that primarily overlooked the crane and construction behind the Casino Royale. It was hardly worth the additional money we paid each night for a "strip view."
reviews.title: Great Customer Service!

likes.liked: — The Lush Rooms and Great Customer Service!

reviews.title: Had to see for myself
reviews.text: Staying in the Venezia Tower takes a bit more navigating to get to the casino and canal shoppes than staying in the Venetian Tower. We took it in stride, though, and adjusted.

Staff with Club Grazie were exceptional and efficient. I can say the same with staff in the Sports Book. Cocktail servers on the floor were less predictable. One night we had a delightful and efficient server who always passed by at the right moment. Two other nights, we had to practically flag down a server to get a drink.
reviews.title: Not worthy of Five Diamonds

reviews.text: Great service, comfy beds, HUGE rooms. 3 TVs, a jacuzzi, beautiful bathrooms. The room was spectacular. No complaints whatsoever. This was my third trip to Vegas and Venetian definately had the best rooms. The casino at Venetian was probably the most packed casino on the strip. The only thing is that room service is pretty expensive and there is a high possibility you'll get lost in the resort because it is so big! The gondeliers here are better than those in Venice...they actually sing to you while the ones in Venice just chat on their cell phones!
reviews.title: Just about everything I wanted

reviews.text: Fantastic holiday experience in Las Vegas with our stay at the Venetian for 3 nights. Well positioned on the strip, the Venetian is 5 star all the way. There is a buzz in the place not like any other casino on the strip. We have stayed at another major casino hotel before but the Venetian was far superior in every facet.
reviews.title: Loved the theme of Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is quite large and on first entering can be confusing making your way to reception and your hotel room. We are a family of 4 and found the Venezia suites very comfortable. Bathroom was very large and the room contained 2 plasma televisions. We were able to get the room at a excellent rate on the internet.
reviews.title: What a Beautiful Place

likes.disliked: — A little large to remember where you are going

reviews.title: Overrated
reviews.text: The settings and surroundings were first class. We found the staff to be more than helpful and security was very tight inside the hotel. Be careful not to use the minibar as prices are quite high but other than that prices are what you expect at a high class 5 star hotel. Will definetely stay again if the opportunity arose at the right price.

What a great stay. No problems at all. I think this is the first hotel suite that I have stayed in and said. "WOW", when I entered it. Although this hotel is there to make money, and it is not exactly practical, (no cofffee maker ,or fridge to store food in", it was beautiful, and does resemble Venice.
reviews.title: Valet Theft!!!!! Beware!!!

reviews.text: I got four free nights at the Venetian and jumped on the offer....me and a college buddy flew from Atlanta to Vegas. The casino feels sort of cramped for a big hotel like this and I did find it strange that there are no coffee makers in the room. You also had to ask for bathrobes, but they were provided if you requested. But the complaints stop there. This is no doubt a 5 star hotel, great rooms, great food options, great service. The only bad thing I could find to say about this hotel is maybe the location since I mostly played at MGM casino. I would definitely pay to stay here again and would gladly recommend this to any of my friends or family.
reviews.title: Two Twenty Two Year Old College Buddies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Celebrating my husband 50th Birthday wanted to make it special. I booked the vip special online. It was to include a upgraded room/ limo transfer and entrance into the azure with a bottle of moet chandon ,plus free slot money and entrance into the Lavo.When we arrived the limo was great and the driver even had a happy birthday sign. When at check in they gave us these vouchers for all of the others that I mention. We soon found out the azores was closed for the season. The front desk reception did not seem to care, I explained I had booked this packaged based on what was included and would be happy just with the bottle of champagne since we were celebrating a special birthday. I asked to speak with the hotel manager and he told the girl at the reception to offer us a 25.00 food and beverage credit . I told her that is not acceptable . She went back to the manager and then he offered a 50.00 credit . I asked her how much is a bottle of moet chandon champange she said 90.00 and also asked her how much is it to get into the azores she did not know. Finally after going back and forth to the manager who never spoke to us he finally agreed to send the bottle of moet to our room with a 25.00 food and beverage credit. All of this wasted time he should have just given us this from the beginning. I was mad that we had to go though all of this. But over all the hotel is beautiful and the rest of the staff was very friendly . I was very happy with the upgraded suite .
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel/Disappointed with front desk reception
AWSOME PLACE!
reviews.text: It was an awsome place. I would recommend this Resort to anyone traveling to Las Vegas for business or pleasure... IF your not on a small budget.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving at the Venetian, everything was fine for 4 of the 5 days that i stayed. But on the 5th night everyone in that hotel seemed to be as rude as possible and not care about their guests. Me and my fiance were in the elevators going up to our room. 2 teenage english boys were harrassing us from the elevator ride up all the way to our room non-stop. We were as polite as possible by telling them to leave us alone and that if they do not we will call security. Well, security didnt seem to care about our problems so we proceeded to go to our room. They followed us all the way down the hall and when i shut the door on them, an instant later it was kicked, shoved, and broken into. We had security on the phone once again to come up and get these kids out of the hotel, but sure enough, it took over 20 minutes for them to make their way even when we said it was an emergency. Once they go there, they did not offer one thing to us besides to have a good night. Well, we were not going to stay in a room that wouldnt lock , nor where these delinquents knew where we were staying. They took over 2 hrs to figure out a room to put us in, then they decided that a smokey filled cigarette room would be just fine. DISGUSTING!!! It was a terrible last night, as well as our night of engagement. Not once, and not ONCE did any employee apologize or offer any kind of assistance with our luggage. They also did not care to find these kids that broke our door down. They also made us fill out a ton of paperwork, which I understand, but we also had to explain it to every single person that we talked to. There was definitely a lack of security there, a lack of empathy from the employees, and a lack of action to resolve the broken down door. Bottom line is I would love to return because it was a nice room, but the people there are completly unaware of how they should act, and security is a joke. I have written letters to them asking if they followed up with any course of action, which they said they would on that night, but I have not heard back from them once...not once. Terrible staff, terrible security, and overall a waste of time on the night I got engaged.
reviews.title: SECURITY IS TERRIBLE, STAFF IS RUDE, WILL NEVER RETURN...

reviews.text: My extended family and I stayed at the Venetian for 6 nights. It was almost perfect EXCEPT there was no coffee maker in the room. For $200+ per night, one expects extra amenities. Bathrobes are not automatically included in the room--you have to call--but at least they are available. However, this was not the case for the coffee maker. Your choice was to pay $20 for a pot from room service or hike to the lobby or food court for take out. Ditto for the newspaper that you pay $16.80 for as part of your resort fee. For $200+ dollars, I expect my newspaper to be delivered to the room. The rooms are lovely so if you don't mind fetching your own coffee and newspaper, I would recommend the Venetian without hesitation.
reviews.title: Almost Great
We were SPOILED at the Venetian
reviews.text: Am I writing about the same place that others have so vehemently complained about? The Venetian Hotel is truly a delightful hotel. It is THE oasis in the Las Vegas desert! I wavered on my decision about staying at the Venetian since I read some unflattering reviews. I am so glad that I stuck with my gut decision and was a guest at this extraordiniary hotel! My husband and I spent 3 wonderful nights being spoiled in our luxury suite in the Venezia Tower. The suite was tremendously spacious and very well appointed. Our room overlooked the Venezia pool which was spectacular. Every staff member we encountered was helpful and down right friendly. The concierge assisted in dinner reservations and steered us in the right direction every time. Our check-in went QUICKLY and smoothly...no more than 7 minutes from arriving in line. We checked out via the Venetian's automatic system with nary a problem. The thing that make this hotel so superb, is the room itself. Honestly, there is not ONE thing I would change. It was huge and beautiful! The bathroom included a large soaking tub and a Swiss shower. It had a vanity area and a double sink. The toilet was in a separate room. The lighting throughout the suite was lovely too. We had 2 flat screen tvs as well. Although people would come and go all night as you would expect in Las Vegas, we never heard a sound from our neighbors! The housekeeping staff are impeccable. Our shower was cleaned daily so as not to have any water drops on it! AMAZING!!! Yes, there is alot of walking to get around the Venetian. I've stayed other places in Las Vegas and everything requires alot of walking! At the Venetian, you're lucky enough to have great restaurants, a nearly smoke-free casino and great shopping all in the same complex. The pool and hot tub setup is fabulous too. You feel isolated because of the way the landscaping is done. How can you go wrong? You can't! Stay at the Venetian and be pampered too!

reviews.title: Love It!!!
reviews.text: We just returned back from a week in Las Vegas. Surprisely the weather was wonderful!!! We stayed at the wonderful Venetian Resort-Hotel. We stay in the Venezia Tower(the Venezia tower is an upgrade, but it is worth every penny!)The suite is large with a sunken living room space. The bathroom is sooo....big and beautiful you won't want to come out of it. Staying in the Venezia Tower you get priorty service, your own private pool area with suna and other special perks...

reviews.title: Had a wonderful time
reviews.text: The staff is friendly and helpful, and at your beck and call 24 hours a day(what more could you ask for!) The Venetian have the grand canal shoppe mall within the hotel( stores,bakeries,cafe,resturants,gondola rides, Madame Tussaud's,shows....). We are very picky when it come to staying at hotels. The Venetiian is one place I highly recommend and will stay again!!!

reviews.title: To the Employees and Management of the Venetian: Thank You Very Much! Grandioso!
reviews.text: Had a wonderful time here. Everyone was very friendly and very helpful. I was a little concerned about some of the reviews but after staying I now know that some people will never be happy wherever they go, so stay home!!! The Grand Lux Cafe is great with huge portions and responsible prices. Delmonico's is overpriced with small portions but good service, guess you pay for the celebrity name. Wolfgang Puck's restaurant had wonderful food. I would recommend staying and would come back. The casino seemed to be venilated better and was less smokey than some of the other casinos we checked out! Have fun!!!

reviews.title: European Elegance at the Ventian
reviews.text: I've read good and bad reviews about the Venetian. Well, I just returned from a one-week stay at the Venetian. While I will agree their slot payout is conservative, this establishment and the service is wonderful. Ok, so I waited in the Check-in line for 15-20 minutes, so big deal! There were plenty of Check-in Assistants, not to mention a pleasant gentleman to refer each guest to the next Clerk. I was given my room at the Venetian Tower three hours in advance; normal check-in policy is 3:00p.m.

The Venetian was outstanding! The entire place is immaculate, clean, and always active. The casino floor was exciting with plenty of tables, slots and games of your choosing. The rooms were gorgeous, spotless, and extremely comfortable. The beds in the room were one of the most comfortable I've ever been in. Although things were a bit crowded (due to Pacquiao/Bradley fight and EDC weekend), the pool was still accessible and clean. The staff is very accomodating and courteous. Highly recommend this resort!
reviews.title: Top notch resort

reviews.text: I've been staying at The Venetian for more than 10 years. Unfortunately, it has deteriorated over this period of time. On this last stay, despite a new $20 per day "resort fee" that was supposed to cover the cost of phone calls and WiFi, it is day three and neither the phones nor the internet access is working due to "system problems".
reviews.title: Sad to see it deteriorate ....

reviews.text: The rooms received a minor update recently, but things are starting to look mismatched rather than elegant like it once did. The unfinished tower is finally draped and the crane removed, so it is less of an eyesore.
reviews.title: Bring your walking shoes!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They stopped pumping in the the wonderful Venetian smell awhile ago and I really miss it. It helped make this place luxurious and special, but now it is just ordinary.
reviews.title: Great trip as usual but not so good this time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice rooms but holy cow, what a walk to get to them. Overall, the staff was very nice but if you happen to get Shonn (possibly Shonne) as your bellman, don't give him anything fragile. he treated a guitar (in the guitar shaped case) as if he were the old luggage test gorilla from the commercials years ago. Completely indifferent to bags whther they were luggage, laptops or the aforementioned guitar.
reviews.title: Terrific Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We LOVED our 3-night stay at the Venetian. It was complete perfection. This was our second trip to Vegas - the first time, we stayed at the Imperial Palace which was awful, so we did our homework this time and chose the Venetian. It surpassed our expectations and more.
reviews.title: Absolute perfection!!!!!!
Well worth it
reviews.text: This hotel is for those who want sumptuous luxury in every detail, as well as a romantic experience, and good service with a great location. We stayed in the new Venezia tower - they put us there (without us asking) even though we had booked a regular suite in the older part. I had read reviews of the decor being a little worn in the original building, but in our room (in the newer Venezia tower) everything was very fresh-looking. Go to the Venetian's website and see for yourself - they have pictures of all the rooms. The suites are huge, the bathrooms are huge with double sinks and a wonderful glass shower. The bathroom was spotlessly clean, as was the rest of the suite. Towels replaced twice daily, along with turn-down service every night. The free toiletries were very nice, although the name wasn't anything I've ever heard of before.

The room service was actually very reasonably priced and the one time we ordered it, it was delivered sooner than expected and the waiter set it up on a tablecloth in our room - complete with fresh flowers. And it was only cheese and crackers!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Viva La Venetian!

reviews.text: Some have complained about the perfume-y smell in the casino - but I thought it was wonderful, and I'm pretty picky about fragrances. I did not smell any smoke at all, just a wonderful scent. There was a different scent piped into the lobby in our part of the hotel. I loved it so much that I bought a bottle of it in the Venezia tower gift shop!
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: In the rooms there are very detailed guidebooks describing the amenities of the hotel and the 17 restaurants there - very helpful. Be sure to make dinner reservations 1-2 days ahead of time. We ate at Emeril's Delmonico steakhouse which was pricey but DELICIOUS, and Tao Asian Bistro which was to die for. We also went to Bellagio's breakfast buffet (on recommendation from Rachael Ray's TV show) and it was inexpensive and AWESOME. Mirage breakfast buffet was almost just at good and I highly recommend this too.
reviews.title: Venetian is OK - at the right room rate only !

reviews.text: My daughter and I traveled here for a quick 4 night stay in December and we were so pleased with our stay. The resort and everyone there was wonderful. We had a bella suite and our room was beautiful although we didn't have a good view. The weather was not so great while we were there but it was OK since we could walk around our resort and the attached mall and eating areas without ever having to get out in the rain. I would love to go back during the pool weather and check out the pools. I will be going back again.
reviews.title: Awesome resort

reviews.text: The only bad thing that we experienced was that the refirgerator in our room was broken and we reported it. When we checked out we were being charged for cokes that we never drank. Apparently if anyone touches anything you get charged...even the maintanence guys. The money was refunded with no hassle but I think the resort should make note of maintenance and not charge the guest in that case.
reviews.title: High quality, nice atmosphere
Lovely hotel, too much smoke for me
reviews.text: There are several top hotels in Vegas, where the quality is at the highest level and you just choose by the style preferred. Venetian is definitely among these few. We liked the quality and we definitely liked the style - the channels, the square and interior elements. A very good choice in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Venetian for our six night stay over New Year and we have good and bad things to say about it. Our Bella Suite with strip view was perfect for watching the fireworks on NYE; beds were extremely comfortable; room was luxurious and water pressure in the shower was very good. The biggest problem for us was the sheer amount of cigarette smoke in both the casino and the room. We had to trek a fair distance through the smoke-filled casino floor to get to the elevators to take us to our room and our non-smoking room carried the distinct smell as well. Coming from a country which heavily regulates public smoking we found this to be overwhelming. We did visit other casinos during our stay and Venetian was definitely one of the best ones for lack of smoke but this speaks more about the poor quality of the other hotels! Another negative aspect was we had to request towels on two different days as the housekeeping staff had not replaced them, instead just removing the dirty ones. Both times we requested towels we had to wait more than 30 minutes for them to be delivered. This was an issue the second time as we were being picked up at 7:30am for the airport and it resulted in me using a clean flannel/face washer to dry myself! The "free" wi-fi was unreliable and not up to the task - only one device could be connected at a time and this was still virtually useless. Lighting throughout the room was VERY dim - we resorted to leaving the toilet light on all night with the door shut as the lighting needed to 'warm up' and this was the only way to be able to see in the windowless toilet room.
reviews.title: The Venetian was beautiful and amazing...but HUGE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the over the top luxury of the Venetian but got lost EVERY time we left the hotel. You could stay here for a week, eat at a different place every meal and still not get through all the establishments. We would have liked a discount on the gondola rides for hotel guests - the cost of these was exorbitant. Overall gorgeous hotel, too much smoke and if we were to return to Vegas we would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Incredible-loved every minute!
A really "Suite" time !
reviews.text: The Venetian hotel is a suite only property. Great location/value. Canyon Ranch Spa, Poker Room, extremely well maintained Friendly staff ! Kosher Coffee Shop on Premises. A really great vacation. Very very comfortable beds and pillows.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there 11th June for 4 days and it was easy check in and automatically upgraded us to better suite when we said we were celebrating a mile stone birthday the hotel is awesome the grandness of it is stunning ! The rooms are all suites and have everything and more you would expect from 5 star apart from a coffee maker. The weather is hot hot hot we walked the strip and went to see celine Dion ( amazing as well would recommend ) definitely would stay here again think of going back sept already.......the beds are the best we have ever slept in
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The Venetian Resort is truly like being in Venice, Italy! The canal with the gondolas offers rides inside as well as outside the hotel. St. Mark's Square has entertainment hourly and the restaurants around the square are wonderful (including the gelato!!!). Designer shops are throughout the property and of course the casino speaks for itself. The suites are fantastic. Our suite looked out over the beautiful pool area. Rooms are very large, comfortable and immaculate. The bathroom is also large with a separate shower and huge tub area. Overall, the Venetian was an incredible experience!!!
reviews.title: Fabulous Resort with enough Shopping, Restaurants and Activities for Everyone!

reviews.text: This resort is not only beautiful, they have the most amazing staff ever who genuinely have hospitality in their heart. The girls and I stayed over Labor Day weekend when Vegas is extra busy, yet the service we received from every staff member was always without rush and so sincere. I had brunch with a girlfriend one day and she dropped me off in front. The door man opened the car door and asked where I was headed. He then signaled another man holding the door who allowed me to hook on to his arm and escorted me thru the casino, pass reception, thru the hotel, thru the pool, and to the front of the line at Tao Beach. This gentleman assured I found my friends before leaving my side. On another day we ordered room service which also came with full service. Our server set up the table, went to get us ice, and even offered to pour our champagne and mix our drinks. I used to take care of hotel VIPs in SF and I'm used to being the one doing all the work. Staying at the Venetian with the girls was a real treat, reminded me what service is all about. Definitely staying here again!
reviews.title: Above and Beyond Like None Other!

reviews.text: To be honest, Vegas isn't my cup of tea- however, I had to travel last year for a conference. I stayed in the old tower (Venetian, as opposed to the Palazzio). I had been to Vegas before, but I was really impressed with this hotel. Having the amount of restaurants/ night clubs between the two hotels, as well as top shopping, was a great option for someone who doesn't gamble that much. Had dinner at both Mario Batalli restaurants as I'm a huuuge fan of his places- also went to Cut by Wolfgang Puck. Overall, the room was very spacious, room service was very good and delivered on time, and the staff was very pleasent even though it was quite busy.
reviews.title: In town for a conference
it's ok
reviews.text: I stayed at the Venetian on Labor Day weekend 2004. This is an All-Suite hotel. When I first saw the room, I was happy with the big roomy space, a Suite, not a retangular hotel room. I noticed a few cost-cutting measures to building a hotel with all Suites.

reviews.title: First-class in any city
reviews.text: First of all, when renting a suite, it normally has more than one person in it. So shouldn't the bathroom doors have locks on them? Everyone had to tell everyone when one was using the restroom or the others would see one taking a shower or using the toilet. Locks are cheap, why cut corners here?

reviews.title: Too big, too loud, too bad
reviews.text: Second, the ventilation in the shower, there is no fan to relieve the steam from the shower. I mean, even my bathroom at home has a fan and a lock, it's not expensive. You would except these little things from a Suite.

reviews.title: Beats the Bellagio
reviews.text: So note the facts, this is an All-Suite hotel, usually a hotel has a few suites which are cleaned and detailed by the best maids and butlers the hotel has, but for the Venetian, anybody is assigned to clean you Suite.

reviews.title: Bad service if you booked w/Hotwire!
reviews.text: The word "Suite" has been diluted here at the Venetian, they should call it "Enhanced Rooms" instead.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a property I cannot see how I can fault this Hotel, beautifully appointed and spotlessly clean throughout. We stayed in a Bella Suite in the Venezia Tower, without doubt the best Hotel room I have ever stayed in, so much space and a fantastic view of the strip. However this fantastic illusion of grand living is soon shattered once venturing on to the Casino floor or into one of the many Bars/Restaurants. Our experience ranged from apathy, most of the staff gave the impression they were there under sufference and could not wait to finish their shift, or in the case of the 'Rattlecan' the barman had to be the most unhelpful, unpleasant individual I have ever come across in a service industry. He seriously needs to seek an alternative career, but despite his best efforts we did enjoy some service and lovely meals along the Grand Canal in particular the Mexican (Try the Prawn Barrito). As many have already alighted to smoke is an issue but this is the fifth hotel I have stayed in Las Vegas and they are all the same, so until someone grasps the nettle and opens a Non Smoking Resort Hotel this is unavoidable. Would I go again to the Venetian on my next trip to Vegas, probably not which is a shame as they have got so much right only to allow too many of the staff to ruin it for them.
reviews.title: Hotel Spot On...Service Very Hit Or Miss

reviews.text: Beautiful rooms with abundant space. Nice atmoshere. Plenty of entertainment and fine dining. Perhaps the 2nd best resort on the strip 2nd to Bellagio. The only negative I can say about the resort is that it's huge. You will most likely get frustrated from all of the walking.
reviews.title: top notch

reviews.text: the hotel looks great, it's location is good, rooms are spacious, I stayed in a Bella suite. Their room service is a disaster, orders take over two hours, the staff are rude even when they are wrong. If you stay in 5 star hotel and pay over $500 a night you expect better service. Cleaning staff are friendly. Hotel is neat, and below par for a 5 star. This is one of the biggest hotels in the world but they don't care about their guests. You are insignificant.
reviews.title: Hotel is nice and in the right place, the service is terrible

reviews.text: Spent four nights at the Venetian over New Year. The Venetian is a lavish glitzy venue, like others on the strip. As long as you are handing over money your a good guest. However, ask for anything you either don't get a response or you are fobbed off. While I am not a gambler I am still a guest but a less important one for the management of the Venetian. There are many restaurants and shopping outlets at the hotel and the internal layout of the shops and restaurants is truly amazing. It is the lack of interest and willingness to assist that grates when dealing with staff at the hotel. This starts from the minute you arrive at check in where the up selling starts to the departure where as long as the tip is paid the service is delivered. There are better places to spend your money and time. The level of smoking and secondary smoke makes this a health hazard for all.
reviews.title: Glitzy but Where's the Service?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Venetian was a great hotel! I read a lot of reviews about it being dated but didn't feel that way at all. I think you have to read these reviews with a grain of salt and realize people have different expectations. Service was great, hotel was clean, beds comfortable, gym facilities were amazing, connecting food and shops were out of this world good. Convenient to other hotels and activities. Only negative thing I would say and maybe it is all of Vegas but the smoking was HORRIBLE! You could not walk any way in the hotel lobby or casino without layers of smoke following you and inconsiderate smokers blowing smoke in your face. Other than that great experience and expect to wash all your clothes twice once you return home!
reviews.title: Great hotel but LOTS of smokers!

reviews.text: I went to Vegas for the first time in August '05. My wife gave me the trip for Father's Day, and her travel agent booked me at the Venetian. It was a GREAT trip and I must say the Venetian was outstanding! My room was immaculate although there was no view, but I was advised of this when I checked in. I don't really care because I wasn't going to spend much time in the room anyway. The rooms are actually mini-suites and have a lot of space with a separate sleeping area, gigantic bathroom, sitting area with a desk, table and chairs, two armchairs, sofa, coffee table.
reviews.title: The Venetian is fabulous!
Loved it!!
reviews.text: The hotel is huge -- over 4,000 rooms -- but the lines move quickly and the staff seemed very nice. The Grand Canal Shoppes and the Grand Canal have to be seen to be believed. The public facilities like the pools are crowded sometimes but not overwhelming. The casino is very nice although you won't find a lot of $5.00 tables on a weeked night. The dealers were very friendly. If you join the Player's Club you can get some coupons and free play in the casino.
The dining is fantastic at the Venetian. Some of the best restaurants in Vegas are at the Venetian. My favorite is Tsunami, where you can get an outstanding meal for very reasonable money.
reviews.title: fantastic
Great Stay
reviews.text: Security in the Venetian is very good. You have to show a room key to access the elevators from the first floor. There is a key-operated door to the elevators on the second floor (Grand Canal level) but no security. There should be a guard there as well as people sometimes hold the door for other people or prop the door open.
I am very picky so here are my suggestions if anyone from the Las Vegas Sands Corporation is listening:
reviews.title: Fabulous Property - Concierge Suites not what expected

reviews.text: Our family of four, myself, husband and two boys, aged 16 and 13 spent 8 nights at the Venetian over Christmas break. In deciding which hotel to stay at, we liked the fact that the suites at the Venetian were large enough to accommodate the four of us in one room, but were a little concerned over the mixed reviews on cleanliness that we read on Tripadvisor. In the end, the fact that several of the shows we wanted to see were in or near the Venetian helped us decide to stay here. Overall, we were happy with our choice.
reviews.title: Christmas vacation at the Venetian

likes.liked: — breakfast restaurants and shows, location on the strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautifully decorated, and our room was cleaned properly every day. We stayed in a Rialto suite which had 2 queens and a sofa bed, a round table that could seat 4, spacious desk area and a large bathroom. The negatives of the room were that there was alot of extra foyer space in the Rialto that isn't used for anything, there is not much space for clothes - one cabinet with shelves, no drawers, and a closet that is situated in the bathroom so that if someone is taking a shower, you can't get to the closet. Also, our room was quite dark as the sunlight didn't reach the window, and the lighting level in the room was very low.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.text: The elevators are well designed so that we never had to wait, despite 4000 rooms in the hotel. The Venetian has a good selection of restaurants, and we particularly enjoyed breakfasts at the Bouchon restaurant and bakery, and the Canyon Ranch Spa Cafe. We noted that checking in to the hotel could take a very long time, but we checked in at 1 am in the morning so had no wait at all. We found the service in all areas of the hotel to be very friendly. The casino area is very attractive and not too smoky. The pool was not open though, we assume because the weather was very cold.
reviews.title: Worth it!!!

reviews.text: One of the best things for us was the Venetian's location on the strip. We could easily cross Las Vegas Blvd to get to the Mirage and Caesars Palace, and the Bellagio was a nice 20 minute walk. The Wynn was only a 10 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Venetian still tops

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note that there is no video arcade in the hotel, so if that is important, then staying at the MGM end of the strip would make more sense (MGM Gameworks, Luxor, Ex Calibur, NY NY all have video arcades).
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms, average check-in

reviews.text: I just stayed here a couple of weks ago for a bachelor party, I have to say it is an amazing Hotel, it is incredible how a hotel this big can work almost perfectly, The pool is nice, the casino not that much. The best place of the hotel is the pool party on fridays, it is full of people from all the other hotels with an amazing party. The bathroom in the room was great and very nice amenities
reviews.title: Great Hotel, More for Families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love The Venetian and it's the only hotel we stay in when we come to Las Vegas. We love the gambling, the people, and the Grand Lux Cafe, which is located right in the casino. Our rooms are so large and so comfortable -- you won't hear one complaint from me!!!
reviews.title: Our Favorite Las Vegas Hotel

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at The Venetian. The suite was nicely appointed and very comfortable. The bed very comfortable and the Wi Fi worked well. The pool area was amazing and we had a lot of fun playing the slots.
reviews.title: Great Time!

reviews.text: We are a family of 4 who is fortunate enough to travel frequently. We visit Las Vegas about twice a year and always stay at the Venetian. We will probably do so again. But on this trip the service was poorer than we had come to expect.
reviews.title: A Bit Disappointing

reviews.text: We returned to our room after a day of activities to find that none of our keys worked. What followed was a 60 minute comedy of errors in which we all sat in the hallway waiting for the appropriate person to diagnose and fix the defective lock, and get us access to our room. What struck me was that all of the staff members seemed confused about what to do and were generally unsympathetic. When we finally went to the lobby reception desk to express our frustration things started moving a little faster. We asked for some compensation for our inconvenience and were offered discount on the room rate. The following day, I checked my billing statement on the TV and found the discount had not been applied. I called the front desk to follow-up. I was advised that the hotel was experiencing problems with the phone system. I was directed by the operator to call back later. So we found ourselves standing in line for a second time at the front desk to work out the problem. Ultimately, we were able to negotiate a reasonable adjustment to our bill.
reviews.title: Best hotel ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Venetian with a room the the Venezia Tower. We thought the standard of service was excellent. The suite at the Venezia was huge. The only drawback was the complicated directions required to get from check-in to our room and, in general, to navigate the Venetian-Palazzo complex. It took us 3 days to feel comfortable getting from point A to point B.
reviews.title: Great time, but not easy to navigate

reviews.text: Count on walking a lot. The Venetian-Palazzo complex is huge as are surrounding hotel-casinos. If you are over 65, plan to take the city bus that goes up and down the strip and buy a monorail ticket if you want to visit the far south and north ends of the strip.
reviews.title: Dont Stay at the Venetian

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First I wanted to say that it wasnt only Valentine's Day but also my brother, 30th birthday party, which he was extremely excited about. We had stayed at the Palazzo for my sister-in laws bachelorette party and had a great time. So, my brother decided to book 2 suites at the Venetian from Feb 13-15th. My brother booked the suites more than a month in advance because he wanted to celebrate his 30th birthday with all his friends. He payed $290 for each suite because he didnt want us to worry about paying for the hotel. He specifically requested 2 joining suites so that we could all be together. My sister in law made reservations for everyone at Tao. Our friends arrived before we did and Venetian was kind enough to give them a room first. However when we arrived my brother learned that the two rooms were not adjoining, even though that is what he specifically requested and booked in advance for. So after 45 minutes of speaking with the front desk they finally resolved the situation and gave us 2 joining rooms in the lower quality towers, with smaller rooms. He requested a discount but they gave him about $20 off. All of our friends who had checked in earlier, gotten comfortable and unpacked, had to repack all their belongings and move to a smaller room in another tower. This took about an hour an half. It took 40 minutes for the bell hop to arrive at the room to help move the luggage. Once we actually got settled in the other room, the cake showed up and we had to rush to get to the restaurant. Three of our friends got there half an hour early to re-confirm the reservation and have a few drinks. Our reservation was at 10 and we arrived at 945, our friends arrive at 9:15. Throughout the day my friends had already spent hundreds of dollars gambling and drinks. When we arrived we spent at least $400 more. We waited for a table until 10:45, constantly checking with the hostesses, who gave us attitude each time. The hostesses never even apologized or offered anyone drinks though it was their fault that we had to wait almost an hour and it was my brothers birthday. So we got seated after 11:00 but there wasn't enough room for everyone, when we tried to get additional tables, the waiter was extremely rude and gave everyone an attitude. This was the last straw and we decided to leave even though we had already spent so much on drinks and waited so long for a table. We wound up eating at a cafe at another casino. That was a horrible birthday dinner.
reviews.title: Lack of customer respect and service!

reviews.text: We decided to spend as little time in the Venetian as possible. On our last night when we got back to the hotel room, the maids had done a lousy job of cleaning our room. The worst part was that my bed did not even have sheets on it. There was just this towel like cover and the blanket. This was disgusting but at 4 in the morning I was in no state to complain and had labeled Venetian the worst hotel in Vegas anyhow. The next day we couldn't wait to leave and headed down to the valet. My brother went down early to get the car. When we came down 20 minutes later they still hadnt brought the car. There was a lot of people so we figured we would give the valet guys a few more minutes. Another 20 minutes later I had had enough and went to go speak with the head valet. I asked him where my car was. We had been waiting over 45 minutes at this point. He said he had no idea where my car was and asked for a description of my car. My car is a four door black VW Passat, if they hadnt found it by now I didnt think the description would help. He said he would ask his next guy to check. This wasted another 15 minutes. The car finally came after more than an hour of waiting for it. They didnt even know where it was and needed to go searching the entire parking lot for it.
reviews.title: This Venetian Did not Meet Standards...Dirty!

reviews.text: Now if you count all of the time and money we wasted and all of the inconvenience, headache, disappointment we received in exchange I would have to say that this was the worst Vegas experience I have ever had. The experience at the restaurant was just abhorable and the epitome of horrible customer service. Labeling your casino a luxury resort with five diamond service may get people fooled once but with the kind of treatment we received I know none of us will ever stay there, gamble there or eat there again. That is about 10 thoroughly disappointed and angry people who were just there to celebrate my brothers birthday and Valentines day.
reviews.title: The worst hotel I have ever stay in Las Vegas

reviews.text: We had two nights in the Venezia Tower and we loved it. Check-in was tranquil - no queues - and we thought our room was great and offered great value for money.
reviews.title: Delightfully over the top

reviews.text: We were amazed at how peaceful it was in our room, once we were in there we couldn't hear a sound from outside.
reviews.title: Venetian was great
Fantastic Service
reviews.text: We were there on weekdays, rather than weekend, and found the Venezia pool very quiet - no cause for complaint.

Our only meal in the hotel was at Bouchon which we felt didn't live up to its hype. It was competent but unremarkable - except that a waiter managed to set one of the tables on fire which livened things up considerably!
reviews.title: Beware if you are going to the pool
very nice but beware the pool...
reviews.text: All in all a good time and we'd definitely go back.

I can't wait to get back to the Venetian, I loved it. The decor is fabulous, it was just so grand and we all had so much fun here. 4 of us traveled to Vegas and we had 2 suites (all rooms are suites here which is a massive bonus) at check in they were very helpful and gave us adjoining rooms which was great. The suites are just lovely but prepare for a walk to the casino floor, it really is not that far but when you take into consideration the size of the regular hotel and how long it would take you to walk to the front desk this is quite far. (you will find the same with almost every hotel in Vegas though so just go with it)
reviews.title: Love this Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suites were very comfortable and clean. The beds are amazing, like clouds and the blackout blinds are great (no little gaps where the light can sneak in) The bathroom was huge and also very clean.
reviews.title: Nice property, let down by details and prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to Phantom (I love the show and they pipe in the music all over the place so it is almost impossible to resist) I got the tickets from a ticket office on the strip that sold them at discount for about $35. If anyone has been to this show and liked it then they will love this. It is shorter that the Broadway production (all the shows in Vegas tend to be about 90 minutes or so) they have just basically cut out all the talking which would be a shame if you have not seen the full version but the theatre was specifically built for this so the the effects are wonderful.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a Cabana in Tao which was good fun but I think next time I would go with the more expensive but quieter (music was really loud) main hotel Cabanas. Also when we got to the entrance to Tao the guy tried to tell us that it was more expensive than we had been quoted on the phone (my friend had booked it before we got there) once she told him this he brought us to our Cabana with no arguments. If you book a cabana know what you are getting and what you are paying for before you get there as they will try to sell you a more expensive package once you get there. We had a minimum spend of €350 with (i think) 10% of each round you order going to the hostess. (tipping the cabana boy was seperate) this did work out quite well as there was a few of us and you can spend the day there. We spent the whole day there and got lunch, a snack and dinner and about 6 jugs of mojitos for about $500. It was a really nice (the food was yum, especially the coconut shrimp) and fun way to spend the day.
reviews.title: Comfortable Room

reviews.text: Plan on going back to Vegas next year and I will be staying here.Great spot!!
reviews.title: AWESOME HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! NOT CHEAP BUT SO WORTH IT!

reviews.text: We spent one night at the Venetian and were overall delighted. It's a very large hotel (over 3.000 rooms), the lobby is as crowded as a train station at peak times, but check-in was fast both at the valet parking (complimentary) and reception. The room (a Venetian Bella) was very large (picture on website are real), well equipped and decorated, so was the bathroom. Kids loved it.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Venetian

reviews.text: We tried the pool at sunset and it was nice, not crowded at all, fast service for towels and drinks.
reviews.title: Kitch and phony yet ... totally opulent, totally Vegas !

likes.liked: — Room size and quality, Grand size of the hotel, Vegas style theme hotel
likes.disliked: — Slow check in, location could be more central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complex hosts a large mall (the Grand Canal Shoppes) in a relatively elegant imitation of Venice squares and canals. A gondola-trip is even possible. Shops are predominantly upscale fashion and jewelry brands, less attractive to kids.
reviews.title: FABULOUS!!! Five stars, all the way!

likes.liked: — The quality of service and accomodations were impeccable!
likes.disliked: — The pool area and the spa prices

reviews.text: We dined at the Canaletto and both food and service were ok.
reviews.title: Stayonly at a good room rate but eitherway visit Tao nightclub if in Vegas
Venetian is nice
reviews.text: The external view from the Strip is quite nice, with soft lighting on the palace and a Rialto-like bridge leading to 1st floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort was really nice as were the rooms / bathroom. We stayed at the Bella Suites in the Venizia Tower. It is far to everything except to the pool in that tower. This tower is better suited for families with small children. Some of the security people were not that friendly - other than that the staff was pretty nice.
reviews.title: Very nice but big

reviews.text: The casino was very nice as were the CW (cocktail waitress).
reviews.title: Pure paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at a few restaurants within the Venetion / Palazzio and they were all good. If I were to stay here again I would try the Palazzio or the Venetion Tower (most probably not at the Venezia Tower).
reviews.title: Luxurious Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Venetian for our honeymoon from 4.6.12 for 8 nights. This hotel is just simply amazing! We do not have 1 bad word to say about it, everything about the hotel is just perfect. The luxury suite is huge and the bed is soooo comfortable and the pillows are just lovely to fall asleep on, I had the best nights sleep while we were there. There are numerous places to eat at the Venetian, we particularly liked the food court as there is so much choice and the prices are very reasonable, we also ate at Wolfgang Pucks restaurant at marks square that was a real treat and the staff were super friendly and very helpful... All the staff we met at the hotel were very polite and helpful to us.
reviews.title: Venetian the place to stay in Vegas

reviews.text: This hotel is the place to be in Vegas especially for a honeymoon, I could not have wished for anymore than what the Venetian offered us and I just really hope that one day we can return there.
reviews.title: Not What It Used To Be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Viva Las Vegas! This was the most fabulous hotel!I would reccomend it to everyone it was excellent in every way,no faults whatsoever!!!
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderfull rooms, top service,great shopping within,Gondola rides in the hotel total luxury,Great eating ,cafes, resturaunts and the trip you out ceiling in the hotel shopping mall is a bright day with blue sky and clouds 24 hours a day! very bizzare to eat at night but inside it is day time was wow wow wow!!!
reviews.title: great hotel and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got married there in vegas in the little chapel of flowers they were first class also as we did it on the spurr of the moment!!very easy to do!!!A must visit was thwe helicopter ride over the Grand Canyon would recommend Papiyon Helicopters what a breathtaking trip!!ask for Megan great pilot!!
reviews.title: The Absolute Worst Hotel Experience of My Life

likes.disliked: — The service and exptremely poor employee attitudes (not an isolated incident).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoy!we did!
reviews.title: Great place to stay - look out if you get hayfever

likes.disliked: — the smell they pump through the hotel & casino

reviews.text: Just got back from a five night stay at the venetian.We went to watch Ricky Hatton and combined the trip with our belated honeymoon.
reviews.title: Booked at the Palazzo -

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights in the new Venezia tower. Rooms are the same as in the big tower; but the atmosphere a little more tranquil. The rooms were huge and lovely. The lobbies and interiors were amazing--attention to detail was very impressive. The service was not as responsive as we would hope. We had several terrific meals at Bouchon, including some magnificent breakfasts. The pool was nicer than I had heard it was; but there are several nicer pools in Vegas.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay

reviews.text: Stayed there for 2 nights and the place definitely exceeded our expectations. As all stated here, got to take advantage of the large room and bathroom. Personally, I thought the pool was better than the mixed reviews posted here. In fact, we loved the pool. As you walk in, bear to the left, the two pools there are better than the right pool. Venzia pool is beautiful too and is very shady. The Canal shops and the gondola were unique but we were amazed by the top notched restaurants at Venetian. The two down sides are; it is a little ways to walk to get to the guest elavators and the Casino itself was just above average.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: It's certainly hard NOT to rate a hotel like this Above Average or Excellent. At $269/night I had high expectations, which were mostly met. The staff were extremely nice and polite and quick to meet our needs. The restaurants were great albeit overly expensive in my opinion (but everything in Vegas is), and basic pool-side drinks like magaritas and daquiris were $8!
reviews.title: Noisy hallways, but overall great experience
Paradise
