reviews.text: My only major complaint beside the price of everything was the amount of noise in the hallway after midnight. The Venetian does not seem to monitor noise because the same poeple were making the same noise three nights in a row. Also, all the room doors close very loudly and woke us up each night. A resort of this kind should have doors that close with a whisper. Also, our deluxe "view" room did have an amazing view of the strip, but it was too bad the windows were SO dirty/spotty; it definitely took away from the nice view.

reviews.title: The Classy Venetian
reviews.text: Overall, the Venitian is a feast for the senses and you won't be disappointed by the famous canal, shopping and other services. But the Casio seemed like every other casino to me. The slots did not seem pay out very well, even the high dollar ones.

reviews.title: Big Prices, Big Rooms and no insulation.
reviews.text: We've stayed here only once and paid quite a bid for a suite during Valentines. We were not impressed! Especially for the money spent, we've stayed at much cheaper hotels and been shocked! Throughout the entire stay we could hear everything going on in the hallway and in our neighboring room. Although the bed was very comfortable, nothing else really appealed to us.

reviews.title: Nice property
reviews.text: Its a nice hotel but its size means you will do a lot of walking. Love the canal area and there are some wonderful looking food shops. Its a great location on the strip too. The hotel does have some shortcomings:

reviews.title: First Trip to Vegas 20 th Anniversary
reviews.text: No coffee pot in the suites, which i find inexcusable in a hotel of this caliber. If you order a pot of coffee from room service it will cost you $20...

reviews.title: My favorite place to stay in Las Vegas!
reviews.text: No drawers in the room furniture to put your clothes in. Not sure why the rooms are furnished with Credenzas with shelfs.

reviews.title: not what it once was
reviews.text: Room lighting is poor.

reviews.title: Venetian is the worst hotel in Las Vegas
reviews.text: you wonder why?, well, the rooms are old, plumbing problems, our non-smoking room was smoky and sadly - customer service was poor...around midnight they suggested to move us since our room was smoky and the plumbing noise from our bathroom could not stop....paying $700 for a simple suite???? I do not think so...and NO remorse from the hotel...they say, if you do not like it, shove it...

reviews.title: Checked Into a Filthy Room
reviews.text: We won a two-night stay through a promotion with an online travel agent. I was very excited about staying at the Venetian, as a five-star resort is never in our budget when we travel. My excitement quickly turned to disappointment, embarassment, and anger after we checked in.

reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.text: We checked in at approximately noon and were told that our room wasn't available -BUT- if we were willing to pay for an upgrade, they would be able to accommodate us immediately. Since we were just excited to be at such a nice hotel, we decided to forgo the upgrade and wait another 3 1/2 hours for our room to be ready.

reviews.title: Stunning Hotel
reviews.text: Around 3:30, we made our way up to our room. Upon entering the room, we were immediately impressed at the size and what looked to be quality of our suite. That quickly turned ugly when I hear my husband say "Oh, gross!" and I turned around to see a dirty towel on the floor. Walking into the bathroom, we saw another dirty towel on the tub. Realizing the room hadn't been cleaned properly, we looked around to see what else had been missed. The nightstand next to the bed was absolutely filthy, with sticky glass rings all over it. Then we noticed on the wall and ceiling some sort of white goo. I immediately called the front desk and what happened next was comical.

reviews.title: Great service, excellent suites, pleasant stay that make the trip worth it
reviews.text: Instead of immediately moving us to another (clean) room, the hotel sent housekeeping to our room. A woman entered the room, apologized, and started cleaning. Then they sent a maintenance man into the room to clean the goo off the wall and ceiling. While we were in the room. As someone who (at the time) worked in the travel industry, I was shocked at the service of this "five star" resort. It got worse from there.

reviews.title: Recent Venetian stay was excellent.. with one exception.
reviews.text: We stayed in a comped room at the Venetian October 26-29 and our overall experience was fabulous. The room quality (strip view) was superb with wonderfully comfortable beds and seating, attractive furnishings, and excellent housecleaning services. The bathroom was almost too nice, all those brass fixtures, marble, tile and mirrors, etc. Our experiences in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the casino per se were profitable, shall we say. All the service staff, ie dealers, slot personnel, drink servers, and ALL the cage cashiers (yes..each and everyone we encountered) were quite helpful and pleasant. There is a grand ambience in the gondola walk area and we always felt "welcomed and comfortable" in most all locales of the property.
reviews.title: Fabulous Venetian

likes.liked: — It was spacious and well appointed

reviews.title: Have allergies? Stay away!
reviews.text: The only service that needs some attention there is the valet. We had to wait 35 minutes for our car and on that particular occasion there were 3-4 other parties that were waiting as well.

reviews.title: had a great time
reviews.text: The logistics regarding where the valet cars are parked and some inherent problem with their communication seemed to constitute the sources of the valet problems. We opted to park in the parking garage after this experience. We'll certainly stay there in the future but we'll scope out the efficiency of their valet service before using it next time. The valet was the only area that

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we could register a complaint about during our stay at the Venetian.
reviews.title: very nice hotel, make sure you check the fine print though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having just returned from a visit that incorporated Thanksgiving, I was very pleased to have chosen the Venetian.
reviews.title: VVVV+ Venetian

likes.liked: — Good location, upscale and all amenities you could ever want

reviews.text: I read lots of reviews before going and was not disappointed.
reviews.title: Still very nice, but some minor issues

likes.disliked: — The front desk has an attitude

reviews.text: The check-in was smooth and our suite on floor 27 was great with a partial strip view. However, we did change rooms (within 20 mins of arrival) as the first appointed was overlooking a giant bank of air-con units - very noisy and not nice to look at. The change was made with minimal fuss.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay at The Venetian

reviews.text: The suites are lovely and the maid service each day superb. My only gripe would be that there is no coffee maker in the room, but I don't think any of the major hotels in Vegas offer this. Bed linen and bed comfort was really good. The bathroom toiletries were very nice and re-supplied daily with towels.
reviews.title: The Venetian With Kids

likes.liked: — Attention to detail both visually and mechanically
likes.disliked: — That it is in Las Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is overwhelmingly huge and by day 7 I was still getting my bearings. The Casino was great and we always were offered a good drinks service when playing. We ate in the Grand Lux for breakfast a few mornings and the buffet on offer for $15 was very good.
reviews.title: Hard to beat

reviews.text: First impressions are everything...
reviews.title: Great stay...BUT..
Gorgeous Hotel ..... Stunning
reviews.text: I loved everything about the Venetian, EXCEPT, the arrival. A group of 6 ladies arrived for the weekend, from the airport in a limo, and NO ONE offered to help us as we arrived, with our luggage or to our room. That's the ONLY thing I would change about our visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous hotel and right in the centre of Las Vegas boulevard, we had an amazing time and can not wait to return. The Venetian is a suite hotel and they must be the best square footage in Vagas.
reviews.title: Very nice - would recommend

reviews.text: I would recommend early morning strolls to see all the sights and also a hidden gem of a restaurant called the Peppermill look it up great value for money as was the champagne brunch at the Wynn its a must.
reviews.title: Fabulous Room, Fabulous Hotel, Fabulous Las Vegas

reviews.text: Our room was ready at 10 am and they checked us in early. The suite was very clean and the cleaning staff did a great job each day. Nice and quiet, did not hear anyone in the hall or adjacent rooms. Not as crowded as other hotels we walked through.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in the Venetian earlier this year after having read a number of reviews on tripadvisor & we definitely made the right choice! The hotel itself is truly impressive the centre-piece being replicas of Venetian squares & canals complete with gondolas. The rooms are equally impressive and are as comfortable as they are stylish. Location turned out to be pretty good too - when we went it was 115F every day and having other hotels and casinos in easy walking distance was welcome. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wonderful!
Terrible Service -
reviews.text: We made reservations requesting no smoking, king size bed. Our request was accepted and I paid in advance for the 1 night stay. This reservation was made over the phone, not on their WEB page. We knew check-in was not until 3:00pm so we spent our afternoon downtown and arrived at the hotel around 6:00pm. We entered registration to the surprise of a long line of customers checking in. After about 15 minutes we were directed to another registration location where we were told there would be no wait. Well, another 20 minutes expired prior to our encounter with the check-in clerk. He found our reservation and asked if we requested no smoking (which I'm sure our preference request was indicated on the computer). I told him, "we were confirmed - no smoking, king bed". He then told us we would need to wait another 2 hours before he could honor our request, "the rooms were not yet cleaned". Hey, by this time it was 6:45pm and we were not prepared to wait 2 more hours for a room. After issuing our displeasure and getting no satisfaction, we requested a refund and went elsewhere. (to "The Hotel", which provided us exactly what we wanted and there was no wait). I will never return to the Venetian.

reviews.title: beautiful
reviews.text: the venetian is just gorgeous. the staff is efficient but not exactly friendly. they wait around expectantly for their tip which i don't like. the rooms are immaculate, large and ornate. even the standard rooms like we had are large and lovely suites with huge windows and a good sized sitting room. if u go to vegas to watch tv, you'll have two to choose from in ur room. the toilet is in a separate compartment from the shower, the large soaking tub and the sinks. the pool area is great and you're given as many towels as you need. theres a large jacuzzi as well and a convenient outdoor shower. i did not eat on the property but the restaurants looked nice. there's a lovely river indoors with gondola rides available should u be so inclined. the valet is speedy, friendly and very helpful with directions/suggestions. check in took a while but that's to be expected. again service was efficient most times but very few smiles. housekeeping was a dream, ask and you shall receive. I had to ask for a coffeemaker and mini fridge and it was at my door in less than 15 minutes. A great feat considering the size of this property.
I'd definitely stay here again, try priceline 5star for $99 if you're staying midweek and you'll get the venetian at a steal! thats what we did.
reviews.title: Lesser Value than Bellagio
The best hotel on the strip
reviews.text: I travel extensively around the world and spend about 80% of my time on the road. This is my nth time to Las Vegas. I have stayed at the Luxor, Paris, Bellagio, MGM, and this time Venetian.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband stayed at the Venetian exactly this time last year and boy did we enjoy our stay. The hotel itself is beautiful inside & out. Gives you the whole Italy feel. Upon arrival and check-in we were amazed at the architecture in the ceiling and walls! Our room was nice and the washroom was fabulous. The food in the hotel was amazing, and the shops upstairs and the design of the square truely makes you feel like you are in venice. The sky-drawn ceiling was spectacular! We really loved it, especially since we went to Venice for our honeymoon 3 years ago and to Vegas (Venetian) for our 2nd anniversary!
reviews.title: Felt like Venice all over again!

reviews.text: This is a great Hotel. All rooms are suites and the room prices are pretty reasonable for what you get.
reviews.title: Venetian - Las Vegas

reviews.text: The pool and jacuzzi were great.
reviews.title: INCREIBLE!

reviews.text: We've been to the nightclub before (TAO), but its always a must to check-out.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: Also, ate at an italian restaurant in the hotel and the food was excellent.
reviews.title: Not cheap but overall good

reviews.text: Spent Superbowl weekend at the Venetian with my 2 adult sons ( 22 and 26). In addition my wife and I make 3-4 trips to Las Vegas per year staying at the Wynn, Bellagio, Venetian and MGM Grand. With over 3500 reviews of this resort posted on this site, I thought I would focus on a couple of things that stood out this weekend.
reviews.title: SuperBowl Weekend at the Venetian

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) We stayed in a room located in the Venetia Tower. Built to be a separate enclave from the rest of the resort, the suites at the Venetia are comparable to other suites at the Venetian. Our room was clean, spacious and very comfortable. No complaints. The one thing to note is that if you are offered a room in this part of the hotel, be prepared to walk and take multiple elevators. It is far enough from the casino, spa and canal stores that it makes you think twice about "running back to the room". Although being separate from the main tower it was no less quiet than I experienced at the Palazzo or Venetian. Also the Venetia use to boast of a separate private check-in for it's guests. The counter was not manned this weekend ( SuperBowl weekend...), so I suspect that this is no longer a benefit to staying in this part of the resort. I also notice that the hotel did not perform regular turn down service in the evening... Something you would expect in a hotel like this. In the end I saw no real benefit to staying in the Venetia Tower..
reviews.title: What a great room and hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) I had Sunday Brunch at Bouchon. This Thomas Keller restaurant is located in the Venetia tower and is something you have to look for. The fresh oysters and unique brunch items were outstanding and did not disappoint. With all the excellent dining options at this resort complex it is really worth seeking out.
reviews.title: Extravagent and Elegant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3) The sports book at the Venetian for Superbowl weekend is highly overlooked. This is not a place to be "seen" or " the party". It is simply a great place to bet on the game and really watch it. It is a fun atmosphere that provides ample drink service and the conversation tends to focus on whether a certain player will score the first touchdown in the 2nd half or will there be a 2 point conversion in game . I have spent 5 Superbowls there and enjoyed them all. The trick/benefit is that there are no reserved seats or cover charge. First come.. first seats... My oldest son got up at 7:30 AM to save us 3 prime seats for the game. By 9:30 ( 3:30 Kickoff) most seats in the sports book were gone. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Magnificent - the solution for a successful anniversary!

reviews.text: I took my wife this weekend to the Venetian. I was really impressed by the room and so was she. The food in the restaurant (Delmonicco's) was excellent. Shopping on the 2nd floor was very convenient. I will definitley return.
reviews.title: Exceeded my Expectations
Best Hotel
reviews.text: This was a fantastic hotel. We did upgrade our room on arrival because I like to open windows and know whether it is daytime or night time! We then had a room with a terrace which was superb to drink my morning cup of tea!!! We looked around most of the hotels on our trip but we were delighted to say that we had certainly picked the BEST. The food everywhere in the Venetian was of very high quality and we ended up eating there most of the time. The shops were brilliant as well. I must say that I spent a lot of cash but this was well worth it!

reviews.title: Nice (by Vegas Standards only.)
reviews.text: Having to travel to Vegas several times per year, I'm always reminded that these properties are really in the casino business (and not the hotel business.) Thus, while a given room and service would be three-stars in a normal town, it dials up to four-stars per Vegas measures. The Venetian has probably one of the top three "standard" rooms in town (along with Bellagio and THEHotel at Mandalay.) It's really just a "pretend" suite, garnering a "separation" feel by dropping the floor of the living area a few steps below the sleeping area. Having said that however, the rooms are very comfortable, and the bathrooms are absolutely the best. The property is too spread out (vintage Vegas) and there's far too much walking here, with constant bumping of elbows with tourists having a "walkabout" through the property. Nonetheless, it's a solid experience, and if the room rate is competetive (it varies widely), it's one of the best "stays" on the strip. I recommend it highly.

reviews.title: Great stay at the Venetian
reviews.text: Just returned from a 11 night stay at the Venetian (4th October 2004), what a fantastic hotel, such beautiful suites and decor in the public area's will take your breath away. I did what a couple of other people advised and pinned a $20 bill to my booking form, when I gave it to the receptionist she said "is this for me ?", I said "It sure is, and if you can find me a very nice non-smoking room I would be very grateful", well she found us a suite on the 29th floor with a fantastic view overlooking the pools and mountains beyond, normally this would have been $35 a night extra so the $20 was very well spent. Everything about the suite was first class, no chips of scrapes on the furniture or walls, huge comfortable bed. My only disappointment was the Grand Lux Cafe breakfast buffet, it was very small and in a cramped area so we went out of the hotel to other local buffet's and got a much better deal. The Venetian also doesn't do a lunch or dinner buffet so we again went to the other casino's for our buffet's, Luxor and Ballys buffet's were excellent, Harrah's always had very long waiting times so I presume that was good also. As we were there for our 40th anniversary we had dinner at Luxor's Sacred Sea Room restaurant, it was fantastic. We took the helicopter trip into the Grand Canyon with Papillon Helicopters and had a champagne picnic on the canyon floor, this again was fantastic, cost $270 each and lasts about 4.5 hours from hotel to hotel. If you want a heli' trip on a budget drive to the Hoover Dam and about a mile before the dam there is a casino with a heli' company beside it advertising heli' trips for $29, now that looks a bargain. Finally, one of the most amazing things about the Venetian is the indoor canal with the Gondola rides, well worth taking the ride @ $15, its a quarter mile long, lasts about 20 minutes and you get Italian songs sung by the Goldolier, tacky I know, but it was fun.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed at the Venetian Mid September 2004. First time at this hotel. The rooms are great - best in Vegas. The casino and atmosphere are wonderful as are the fine restaurants. The Canal restaurants are not much better than a your standard casual dining at home. The pool area was very nice, but nothing special. The monorail was not working during my visit, so cab fares added up quickly. I will choose Venetian again.

reviews.title: Venetian is fantastic
reviews.text: We did a lot of online research before an Oct. weekend in Vegas and decided on the Venetian. What a great choice! Our room was very spacious, quiet and didn't show a bit of wear. The bed was extremely comfortable and the marble bathroom with a double sink and separated large tub and shower was great. Check-in was easy and we didn't encounter any of the staff surliness described in other reviews. Everyone we dealt with was polite and professional. Also, the casino was one of the few we visited that didn't smell like cigarette smoke, even when it was full. The only shortcoming was the hike getting from the sidewalk of the Strip to the room but that seemed to be the case at all the mega-resorts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a fancy, top-of-the line five star hotel in Las Vegas, the Venetian is a great choice.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Great Value

reviews.text: We went for three nights in early September.
reviews.title: Bring some breadcrumbs...
Showing some wear
reviews.text: The hotel is huge, but the staff is truly courteous and helpful, going out of their way to make sure your stay is as comfortable as possible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in (or -out) takes much too long, due to the sheer size of the hotel, and thus the amount of people.
reviews.title: 5 nights in Venezia Tower

reviews.text: If you use a debit card, a deposit is held until you check out. Also, if you wish to be able to charge things to your room, when using a debit card, an outrageous fee over around 400 dollars is held from your card. Don't do this unless you have plenty of cash in your account (use a regular credit card, if you can).
reviews.title: WOW Venetian

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel. It isn't brand new but it is still beautiful. Staff was great and food was excellent and reasonable in all restaurants we ate in. Didn't get rich, but did win on slots and black jack.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great City. Don't listen to Obama.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also took the helicopter trip to the Grand Canyon (Maverick). A little pricey but fantastic ride!
reviews.title: One of the most beautiful hotels on the strip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second time at the Venetian. In 2005, we stayed there for four nights and on average paid $189 per night. Last week, Feb/2010, we stayed there for 4 nights and thought we paid $169 per night. However, after we got home,we discovered they tacked an additional $19 a day to our final bill. (so, again, an average of $189 per night). We called the Venetian to ask about the fee and were told it's not a tax, but a fee added recently to cover 'conveniences' (that we never used, btw) but, evidently, we agreed to it when we signed for the room at check-in. Still, in all honesty, the suite was worth so much more than we paid. We'd still stay there again (though will pay more attention to what we're signing next time). Be aware that there is no coffee maker or hair dryer in the room. Maybe it was an oversight, but we didn't get a shower cap either. My husband absolutely needs a couple of cups of coffee to start the day. Thankfully, there were kiosks that sell coffee and pastries located right off the elevator area and open as early as 6:30 a.m. The Grand Lux Cafe is owned by the Cheesecake factory and was really excellent. A little pricey, but the portions were huge. ie...I ordered a slice of carrot cake for breakfast one morning thinking I'd eat 'lite'. lol...it was the size of a dinner plate and surrounded by mounds of whipped cream. Absolutely delicious, but I could have shared it with two other people.
reviews.title: little italy--almost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this is a special place ,we had a suite very well presented and kept clean.the position is in the middle of the strip and is good for getting up and down.the only downside the front desk made a mistake with my credit card details and for a short time i was made to feel like a criminal--their fault --said sorry but that was it untill i checked out and then was offered a $25 bearkfast offer. Other than everyone we met was friendly and helpfull.
reviews.title: Five-Star Spaces; Two-Star Service

reviews.text: The pool was closed whilst we were there no option offered.
reviews.title: AMAZING Hotel, AMAZING Piazza Suite, AMAZING Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there for 4 nights, starting Jun29th.
reviews.title: Could not have wished for better!

likes.disliked: — The fact that we had to pay $10 per night for internet access

reviews.text: Since it was (part of) our honeymoon, we wanted something really special and that's what we got. Incredible rate too, for that time of the year - $179 per night for Venetian King. Were upgraded to luxury king overlooking the pool area and the Strip.
reviews.title: A disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just sat there the first hour after arrival, staring. It all is quite overwhelming, when you're from Holland, haha. Anyway, check-in was extremely swift and courteous. Room was excellent, and yes, you can see that it is not brand new anymore, but that does not matter to me. The size and luxury of the room is just amazing.
reviews.title: Fabulous service

reviews.text: Service everywhere good. One critique: roomservice. Food was cold when it arrived, but since it had been a long time since we'd eaten, we did not send it back. Food is too pricey, though, to be served cold. Did complain, but never got back to us. Could have done better on that point.
reviews.title: This hotel has spoiled me for life...

reviews.text: On our one-week anniversary, we went to dinner at Valentino's. WOW! What an explosion of taste. We both took the 4-course 'cookbook' menu, and it was incredible! Best chicken I've ever tasted. Wine prices a little steep ($13 for a Chardonnay, come on?!) but otherwise perfect in every sense.
reviews.title: Out of this world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a mixed review. Let me start by saying I did a TON of research prior to this trip. I have been to Vegas a few times before, but this trip was for our 10th Anniversary and I wanted it to be special and memorable.
reviews.title: A little disappointed...

reviews.text: We got a good online rate, an average of $160.00 per weekend night for a "view" room. The cab ride from the airport was about $25.00 one way since the hotel is located pretty far north, so plan for that if you don't have shuttle service. Check in was quick and easy. Lobby was absolutely gorgeous. I angled for an upgrade (which I NEVER do) but since it was our anniversary, I figured why not? I was told NO upgrade was available to us. Okay...
reviews.title: The suites are outstanding

likes.disliked: — No coffee maker in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Loved our stay on Nov 16 -19

likes.disliked: — wish the pool scene was more active

reviews.text: Moving on. The smell. If you like the smell of super-sweet flowers, like freesia, this will be fine for you. But it is strong! Especially in the hallways. I love candles, flowers, perfume, etc. But even for me it was like, whoa! It does cover up the smoke smell and the casino was really well ventilated. But if you are sensitive to smell, you will have a tough time here.
reviews.title: Generally disappointing

reviews.text: Our room was lovely, just like the pictures. Comfortable bed, clean, and very quiet. Few minor problems; a light bulb out in the bathroom, a broken lamp shade, items already missing from the mini-fridge. Bath tub was smaller than mine at home. No big deal for us.
reviews.title: It's only been a week, but I miss the Venetian already!

likes.disliked: — location, its not as close to the centre of the strip as you would think

reviews.text: Liked my room, good rate through convention I was attending. The hotel overall has some nice features, though one cannot help but notice it's looking a bit worn here and there.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but showing signs of wear and tear

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would certainly stay again if booking at reasonable price.
reviews.title: You will n ever see me in this hotel again

reviews.text: Arrived at this hotel from San Francisco and was meeting my husband there, my husbands flight from NY had been delayed, the hotel wouldn't let me check in the room without him, told me that even though I had ID saying who I was etc that without him would have to stand to one side and wait, after 1 and a half hours of standing at reception as there are no seats, I went back to reception and was told that if I rebooked the room they would let me in, felt like I had been treated dispicable, and that is no way to treat someone at 11:30 pm at night. Will never ever stay in this hotel again, not accomadating whatsoever The staff should be retrained, I spoke to several of them that evening. After being told I could have a room, I had to wait 1/2 hour for a porter to help with the bags.
reviews.title: great hotel, location and services

reviews.text: love this hotel have stayed there a few times and has never disappointed, great shopping, gambling, eating and very nice rooms - probly more expensive than most but worth the extra.
reviews.title: Elegant

reviews.text: The Venetian is such a beautiful hotel. Everything is so "grand". The rooms are large with a large bathroom. The front desk people were very nice and were able to get us a room at 10:00 am. Room service food and delivery person was great. The Grand Luxe had nice servers, good food, and the line moved quickly. My only complaint...having to pay for internet service. I think if I pay $300 a night for a room, the internet should be included. I would stay here again, but need to experience other Vegas hotels!
reviews.title: Great hotel
